text: @tommieinthemiddle sorry - when they next release sales figures

@batgirlscoffee Well I don't have inside knowledge as you seem to but the point of a boycott is that it represents as much of a loss to the target as the boycott is successful. Saying 'Oh but it won't make a difference' is like telling people not to bother voting. Does your Mom work for Gillette or something? Why are you so keen to argue that the profit margins of global corporation will be unaffected by a boyvott? I don't support companies that spread sexist stereotypes - I encourage others to do the same. That Nike are successful while using child labour abroad is not a reason not to boycott their products. So yes, it's still a boycott and it's success can be measured when they next Ten
@tommieinthemiddle it means that it won't massively affect them (like a boycott should) because they knew it was going to happen and prepared for it.

@batgirlscoffee What on earth do you mean? I'm boycotting all P&C products as are many others. If they were wise enough to project those losses, that's ok. It doesn't mean I'm not boycotting anything. It's a straightforward thing.

@tommieinthemiddle good thinking...but still wasted money. The bad thing about the boycott is that you aren't boycotting anything. The company did the numbers knowing the market they would lose and decided it was worth it.
@batgirlscoffee Had some from before seeing this ad and decided to send a message rather than throw it out. Figured there'd be others in a similar situation.
"Boycott" by buying their products with your money and then burning or breaking the products you paid for???
